item.title: What is your method for backing up your HyperV virtual machines?
item.description:
Steve Endow, a Dynamics GP Certified Trainer and Certified Professional, outlines his simple and reliable method for backing up Hyper-V virtual machines (VMs), acknowledging that while more advanced solutions exist, he prioritizes simplicity and trust. Endow uses traditional backup solutions for regular files but highlights the unique challenge of backing up large VM files, which consume significant time and storage space. He prefers manual backups using compression tools like 7-Zip over potentially complex VM backup solutions...

item.title: Additional HyperV Resources
item.description:
During my attempt to move a Virtual Server 2005 VHD file to HyperV, I ran into network issues within the virtual server. Thankfully, I came across an article outlining steps to prep a virtual server before a HyperV migration. As a safety measure, creating backups of the VHD and VMC before any changes is recommended. http://blogs.technet.com/askcore/archive/2008/09/19/migrating-to-hyper-v-from-virtual-server-or-virtual-pc-tips-and-suggestions.aspx This led me to a tool designed to simplify VMC to HyperV file conversion. Since I only have a handful of servers, creating new virtual servers and attaching the VHD remains efficient...
